intro: Linaria arvensis, commonly known as the common toadflax, is an annual or biennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces bright yellow, spurred flowers that bloom from June to August, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate along the stem, often with a slightly hairy texture. Linaria arvensis thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
